        Return {+1, -1} uniformly
        Returns:
        Either 1 or -1 from a uniform distribution.

      • checkRangeQuery

        private boolean checkRangeQuery(KDTree tree,
                                KDPoint origin,
                                double range,
                                KDPoint... candidates)
        Check whether a range query on a KDTree is satisfied.
        Parameters:
        tree - A populated KDTree.
        origin - The KDPoint used as the center of the range query.
        range - The maximum KDPoint.distance(KDPoint, KDPoint) that any KDPoint can have from origin in order to satisfy our query.
        candidates - A varargs array containing the ground truth answers to our range query.
        Returns:
        true iff all the KDPoints in candidates are at a {link KDPoint.distance(KDPoint, KDPoint) of at most range from origin.

      • checkKNNQuery

        private boolean checkKNNQuery(KDTree tree,
                              KDPoint origin,
                              int k,
                              java.util.List<KDPoint> neighbors)
        Check whether a K-Nearest Neighbors query is satisfied by a KDTree.
        Parameters:
        tree - A populated KDTree.
        origin - The KDPoint to calculate the nearest neighbors of.
        k - The number of nearest neighbors to compute.
        neighbors - A List containing the ground truth response to the query.
        Returns:
        true iff the KDPoints in candidates are the k nearest points to origin, as dictated by KDPoint.distance(KDPoint).

      • checkKNNQuery

        private boolean checkKNNQuery(KDTree tree,
                              KDPoint origin,
                              int k,
                              KDPoint... neighbors)
        Check whether a K-Nearest Neighbors query is satisfied by a KDTree. Different from checkKNNQuery(KDTree, KDPoint, int, List) in the type of last argument.
        Parameters:
        tree - A populated KDTree.
        origin - The KDPoint to calculate the nearest neighbors of.
        k - The number of nearest neighbors to compute.
        neighbors - A varargs array containing the ground truth response to the query.
        Returns:
        true iff the KDPoints in candidates are the k nearest points to origin, as dictated by KDPoint.distance(KDPoint).

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        A setup method that runs before every one of our jUnit testing methods.
        Throws:
